play.mvc

Class EssentialAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • scala.runtime.AbstractFunction1<play.api.mvc.RequestHeader,play.api.libs.streams.Accumulator<akka.util.ByteString,play.api.mvc.Result>>
      • play.mvc.EssentialAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    play.api.mvc.EssentialAction, play.api.mvc.Handler, scala.Function1<play.api.mvc.RequestHeader,play.api.libs.streams.Accumulator<akka.util.ByteString,play.api.mvc.Result>>

    public abstract class EssentialAction
extends scala.runtime.AbstractFunction1<play.api.mvc.RequestHeader,play.api.libs.streams.Accumulator<akka.util.ByteString,play.api.mvc.Result>>
implements play.api.mvc.EssentialAction, play.api.mvc.Handler
    Given a `RequestHeader`, an `EssentialAction` consumes the request body (a `ByteString`) and returns a `Result`.

    An `EssentialAction` is a `Handler`, which means it is one of the objects that Play uses to handle requests. You can use this to create your action inside a filter, for example.

    Unlike traditional method-based Java actions, EssentialAction does not use a context.
